title.narrative: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN IN CONTACT WITH THE LAW

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, national legislative and implementation systems increasingly provide for a protective and caring family environment that enables families and children to demand and benefit from enhanced access to and use of community-based child and family services, quality alternative care, justice system, and protection systems against violence in all environments.

related-activity.ref: 1600/A0/06/884 CHILD PROTECTION, ALTERNATIVE CARE AND JUVENILE JUSTICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the application of child friendly approaches for children in contact with the law through the development of a comprehensive concept for reforms, capacity building of 100 justice professionals, and development of quality monitoring and multidisciplinary mechanisms. ;;In cooperation with the Embassy of France and the Supreme Court of Georgia, UNICEF initiated policy dialogue on the introduction of the concept of Child Judge.UNICEF assisted the Juvenile Referral Centre to deliver programmes for children with difficult behaviour and children below the minimum age of criminal responsibility ;to enhance the effectiveness of the Diversion and Mediation Programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems, Text

baseline.value: Specialization standards, as well as curricula and professional supervision mechanism exist and institutionalized in criminal justice, however not updated regularly No specialization standard curricula (except judicia

target.value: 2025:Professional supervision mechanism (including regular capacity building) is in place and provides regular supervision of cases concerning children in criminal and civil justice

actual.value: 2021:Specialization standards as well as training curricula and modules are developed and approved by the respective agencies in criminal and civil justice systems
